author: Sabrina Snyder
title: Corn Chowder with Cornmeal Dumplings
ingredients: 3 cups sweet corn (, frozen or fresh)
2 russet potatoes (, peeled and diced (Yukon okay too))
3 cups sweet corn (, frozen or fresh)
2 russet potatoes (, peeled and diced (Yukon okay too))

instructions_list: Add butter to a large heavy-bottomed pot.
On medium-high heat, add in the onions, cooking them until they are translucent (about 4-5 minutes).
Add chicken broth, corn, potatoes, heavy cream, hot sauce, chili powder, and salt.
Stir well and bring to a simmer, uncovered, for 4-5 minutes.
While the soup is simmering make the cornmeal dumplings: In a large bowl whisk together the flour, cornmeal, baking powder, and garlic salt until well mixed.
Add in the milk and whisk.
Stir in the green onions and cheddar cheese.
Drop-in small heaping tablespoons onto the soup.
Cover the pot and let it simmer on medium-low for 20 minutes (no peeking).
description: Corn Chowder with Cornmeal Dumplings is the perfect creamy, hearty dish ready in around 30 minutes with corn, potatoes, and soft cornmeal dumplings.
